comments.text:
Basically our entire existence, the Earth, the Universe, everything,  is a 
simulation. The spoon is not there, it only has meaning as a spoon if we 
give it that meaning. Things only have purpose if we give them that 
purpose, without the observer, without us, nothing exists. Kinda like the 
theory of the atom which states that an atom does not exist until apply 
measurement to it. So the kid is right, there is no spoon.

comments.author: LucisFerre1

comments.text:
That's the root of all magic and religion. It's not the spoon that bends, 
it is only yourself. That is, miracles are in your head. All magic is in 
your head. It's your perception that bends. Religious mystics, witches and 
wizards are hacking their own minds. They can also hack the minds of others 
via auto-suggestion and placebo effect, not to mention good ol' everyday 
parlor tricks. This is why belief is paramount for magic and miracles to 
"occur", and why you can't con an honest man. ﻿
comments.author: LucisFerre1

comments.text:
How is it possible that millions of people walking around believing that 
they are free, not realizing that in reality, they are slaves? The answer 
is....they don't what real freedom is. They think just because they can 
walk into any supermarket and choose from 20 different cereals, 15 
different bagels and because they can watch 800 different channels on their 
television, they are free. When it comes to things that really matter, 
things that are really important....we have no choice. We really don't have 
a say. The system only is giving us the ILLUSION of choice. We are not in 
control. We are slaves. It's time to wake up!

"We are the most unfree "free" people that have ever existed."

- Henry H Lindner﻿
comments.author: ManufacturedReality

comments.text:
That is certainly one possibility. The idea that our whole sensorium is one 
vast delusion is why Sartre started with "I think, therefore I am." But the 
advent of science means that we can now measure external objects with 
scientific methods and devices that don't require the (potentially 
fallible) human brain. A mass spectrometer will tell you the atoms that 
compose the spoon, thus confirming that it exists.
comments.author: Gj23jk2

comments.text: no the spoon is just electrical signals interpreted by his brain
comments.author: Monika Heinze

comments.text:
A scientific/philosophic metaphor, like many in The Matrix. Despite 
appearing entirely different, the spoon is no different than yourself at a 
basic level. Merely atoms of minutely varying dimensions, cavorting in 
space, bound together in different forms by physical forces we do not yet 
understand. There is a spoon. There is also a you. But the difference is 
like that between a beach and a sand castle. The spoon is you, you are the 
spoon, and both of you are starstuff. Sagan Drop for the win.
comments.author: Gj23jk2
